Package chess

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game represents an instance of a chess game Contains method that controls the game, keeps track of turns, valid moves, checks etc.
    Author:
    Vincent Phung, William McFarland

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) Square[][] board
      Array of squares to represent the actual board with pieces on it.
      (package private) Board boardObject
      Instance of the board class.
      (package private) boolean drawOffer
      Boolean to represent if a draw was offered.
      (package private) boolean gameOver
      Boolean to represent if the game is over.
      (package private) Square prevEnpassant
      The previous enpassant square.
      (package private) boolean whiteTurn
      Boolean to represent if it is white or black's turn.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Class constructor to create a new game instance. Initializes board and the game settings such as turn.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Method to start a game. Takes in user input until the game is over and displays the chess board.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Square[][] board,
                       Square curSquare,
                       Square destSquare)
        Determines whether the piece on the currently selected square can move to the destination square successfully. Does not check if the move puts their King in check.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        curSquare - The currently selected square.
        destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        true if the piece on curSquare can successfully move to destSquare.

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece​(Square[][] board,
                      Square curSquare,
                      Square destSquare)
        Moves the piece on the currently selected square to the destination square
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        curSquare - The currently selected square.
        destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.

      • kingLocation

        private Square kingLocation​(Square[][] board,
                            java.lang.String color)
        Searches for a certain colored King's position on the board
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        color - The color of the King to search for.
        Returns:
        The square that the king is located at.

      • promotion

        private void promotion​(Pawn curPawn,
                       Square destSquare,
                       char newType)
        When a pawn reaches the last row of the opposite board it is exchanged for a different piece of the same color.
        Parameters:
        curPawn - The currently selected pawn to promote.
        destSquare - The square that the pawn is moving to.
        newType - The type of piece that the pawn is being promoted to.

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck​(Square[][] board,
                       Square curSquare)
        Determines if the selected square can be attacked by an enemy piece
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        curSquare - The currently selected square to check.
        Returns:
        True if the currently selected square can be attacked by an enemy.

      • isCheckmate

        public boolean isCheckmate​(Square[][] board,
                           Square kingSquare)
        Determines if there are no possible moves that can get a king out of check. There are possibilities to get out of check: 1.King moves out of check , 2. Another piece blocks the attacker, 3. The attacking piece is captured.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        kingSquare - The square that the king is located on.
        Returns:
        True if all checks fail then there are no possible moves that can get a king out of check.

      • getKingAttackers

        private java.util.ArrayList<Square> getKingAttackers​(Square[][] board,
                                                     Square kingSquare)
        Get a list of all of the squares that contain a piece that can attack the king.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        kingSquare - The square that the king is located on.
        Returns:
        List of all of the squares that contain a piece that can attack the king.

      • simulateMove

        private boolean simulateMove​(Square[][] board,
                             Square curSquare,
                             Square destSquare)
        Simulates a move using a combination of canMove and isCheck. Checks if a move is possible and does not put the king in check.
        Parameters:
        board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
        curSquare - The currently selected square.
        destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        True if the move can be made and does not put the king in check.
